articles.title: Introduction to R Programming
articles.contents:
Welcome to the website for Introduction to R Programming!
This website contains course materials and outside resources for an
introductory R programming course.
Website Content
The Schedule
section provides a schedule of topics and links to supplemental
resources.
The Resources
heading lists several helpful resources for R learners. R for Data
Science will serve as the primary text for this course. It’s available
for free online,
but well-worth the cost for the paper copy.
The Modules
heading contains most of the course lecture content. You’ll find all
presentations/lecture notes here.
The Project
Problems heading contains all of the practice projects
problems.
The Project
Solutions heading contains all of the solutions to the
practice projects problems. I’ll add these solutions to the website
about 24 hours before the next week’s lecture so that you have an
opportunity to try out the problems yourself before viewing the
solutions.
Lectures
Lectures will take place via Microsoft Teams every Friday at 10:00 AM
PST starting June 10, 2022.

articles.title: Resources
articles.contents:
Books
Below are listed what are in my opinion the best books on R
programming. All of these are freely available online and can be
accessed by clicking on the book images below. In addition to these
books, the Big Book of R is a large repository of just about
every book focused on R. At the time of this writing, there are over 250
books listed in this repository, which span a wide range of topics (r
programming, shiny app development, statistics, machine learning, sports
analytics, etc.).
R Programming
  This book is widely considered
essential for learning R and will serve as our primary text.
  Good
supplemental resource for base R
Data Visualization
  Great overview of the ggplot2 package
  Good
resource for data visualization with a focus on concrete
applications
R Markdown
  The most comprehensive guide to R Markdown

  Great guide to R Markdown with
specific strategies and use cases
Websites
R Studio Education
R
Bloggers
Community
R4DS
Online Learning Community
R User Groups
R Ladies Groups
R Conferences
Tidy Tuesday
